intro: Heterochiton fontanesii, commonly known as the Fontanesii's heterochiton, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
